policy: VCA policy is established and documented.
The policy is communicated to all employees.
The policy is regularly evaluated and updated.
The VCA policy includes the following components:
- Policy Statement (VCA 1.1): Management has established and confirmed the OHS policy in a policy statement. This statement is evaluated every three years and updated as necessary.
- OHS Officer (VCA 1.2): An OHS officer is appointed within the company, responsible for coordinating OHS aspects in daily operations.
- OHS Structure (VCA 1.3): The OHS structure is schematically shown in the organization chart. Job descriptions are available for all management positions and the OHS officer.
- Management Assessment (VCA 1.4): The director assesses all managers annually using the assessment form. OHS is an explicit topic of discussion.

- Internal Audit (VCA 1.5): The OHS officer performs internal audits annually according to a fixed schedule in the annual plan. All applicable questions from the VCA checklist are assessed evenly distributed over a three-year period.
- Management Review (VCA 1.6): Annually, management assesses whether the VCA** system and organization meet VCA* requirements. The output is recorded in the management review/annual plan document.
risks: OHS risk inventory and evaluation (RIE) is prepared in accordance with legal requirements.
The RIE explicitly addresses the inventory of operational activities, associated hazards, and risk assessment.
The action plan establishes effective measures for risks, with source control preferred.
The RIE and action plan are periodically (at least every three years) evaluated and adjusted if necessary.
A Task Risk Analysis (TRA) is prepared for each job if necessary.
Last Minute Risk Analysis (LMRA) is performed before starting work.
risks_frm_tra: TRA form is available for preparing task risk analyses.
Completed TRA's are documented and stored.
risks_risk_inventory_evaluation: RIE is prepared in cooperation with the external safety expert.
Action plan (PvA) is prepared with action items, responsible parties, and deadlines.
Overview of risks and measures is available.
Action list is maintained and evaluated.

policy.title: 1. Policy
policy.description: The VCA policy section covers policy statements, organizational structure, job descriptions, assessments, and management reviews.

policy_statement.title: Policy Statement (VCA 1.1)
policy_statement.content:
The board of Optic Infra is aware of its responsibility regarding the care for Safety, Health, Welfare and Environment (VGWM).

Creating and maintaining safe and environmentally responsible working conditions are important objectives in our organization and a fixed part of the general business policy. The VGWM policy aims to prevent personal injury, fires, damage and exposure to hazardous substances as well as to limit negative effects on the environment as much as possible. In addition, in the case of (partial) work disability of employees in service after, for example, an accident or occupational disease, in consultation with the Occupational Health Service and other experts, suitable work within the organization will be sought. The Gatekeeper Act will also be complied with.

To the best of our ability, we will act in our organization in such a way that Safety, Health, Welfare and Environment with respect to our employees, temporary employees, temporary workers, clients, subcontractors, visitors and third parties is guaranteed and they are not exposed to unacceptable risks, discrimination, intimidation and violence.

Care will be taken to ensure that government rules are strictly complied with and continuous improvement will be strived for in the field of Safety, Health, Welfare and Environment.

Within the company, everyone is informed and kept informed about VGWM responsibilities, procedures and instructions. This is done through information, training and instruction. Management has established and confirmed (by signature) the OHS policy in a policy statement. This statement is evaluated every three years and updated as necessary.

The policy statement is communicated throughout the company through the introduction/information program for (new) own and temporary employees. The policy is also communicated to employees.

ohs_officer.title: OHS Officer (VCA 1.2)
ohs_officer.content:
An OHS officer is appointed within the company (see organization chart and appointment letter), who is responsible for coordinating OHS aspects within the company in daily operations.

The OHS officer reports directly to management. Tasks, responsibilities, authorities, and requirements are further elaborated in a job description.

ohs_structure.title: OHS Structure (VCA 1.3)
ohs_structure.content:
The OHS structure is schematically shown in the organization chart.

Job descriptions are available for all management positions and the OHS officer, in which tasks, responsibilities, and authorities are clearly described.

job_description_executor.title: Job Description Executor

job_description_vgm_officer.title: Job Description OHS Officer
job_description_vgm_officer.content:
Place in the organization
The OHS officer is accountable to the director. He has no managerial tasks.

The OHS officer also fulfills the role of prevention officer within the company.

Responsibility
The OHS officer is co-responsible for coordinating the OHS aspects within the company during daily operations and ensuring the input of expertise. He is also responsible for implementing and maintaining the management system in accordance with legal and normative requirements.

Tasks/responsibilities
- Drafting and maintaining the management system.
- Performing internal audits.
- Supporting the execution of risk inventory and evaluation and task risk analyses.
- Processing OHS registrations, reporting findings to management.
- Supervising compliance with the management system and intervening if necessary to adjust;
- Handling accidents and deficiencies: investigation/root cause analysis, corrective measures, implementation, registration.
- Advising on safety, health, and environment (management, organization).
- Preparing management review (presenting information, registration).
- Monitoring safety, health, and well-being of employees (if necessary with support from occupational health service or other external experts).

Authorities
- All authorities to carry out the above tasks.
- Taking corrective and preventive measures.
- Intervening in the business process if necessary.
- Interrupting work activities where necessary to provide instruction and/or explanation.

Education and experience requirements
- MBO work and thinking level.
- Acquired industry-related expertise in the field of safety, health, and environment (including applicable laws and regulations).
- Good command of the Dutch language in speech and writing.
- Good communication skills.
- Good knowledge of the own quality system.
- Valid VOL-VCA diploma with (safety support is provided by KAM advisor).
- Preferably external training as internal auditor.

Note: The safety support must demonstrably possess a diploma in Middle Safety Science (MVK), Higher Safety Science (HVK) or the Belgian equivalents Prevention Advisor Level II or Level I.

Replacement
In case of absence, the tasks are performed by the director or delegated to the external advisor.

management_assessment.title: Management Assessment (VCA 1.4)
management_assessment.content:
The director assesses all managers annually using the assessment form. This assessment is based on the job description. OHS is an explicit topic of discussion.

A report is made of the assessment in the assessment form. Any actions are included in the report with responsible party and planning.

internal_audit.title: Internal Audit (VCA 1.5)
internal_audit.content:
An internal audit is an internal assessment of compliance with established standards or requirements. The OHS officer performs internal audits annually according to a fixed schedule in the annual plan. He is supported by the internal audit form.

Evenly distributed over a three-year period, all applicable questions from the VCA checklist are assessed. The results of these internal audits are recorded in a report.

management_review.title: Management Review (VCA 1.6)
management_review.content:
Annually, management assesses whether the VCA** system and organization meet VCA* requirements. As input for this assessment, the following data are used, among others:

- Results and effectiveness of the previous management review.
- Report and action plan of internal audit(s) (actions, deadlines, responsible parties, establishment and evaluation of action items from previous internal audit).
- Report of external audit(s).
- Accidents with work disability, accidents with adjusted work, accidents without absence/work disability (from first aid), near misses, unsafe situations and actions, and other OHS incidents.
- Objectives and actions regarding IF.
- Risk Inventory and Evaluation (RIE), Environmental RIE, and Action Plan following RIE (PvA).
- Task Risk Analysis (TRA's).
- OHS inspections and action items.
- OHS-responsible materials, resources, and PPE.
- Reporting and investigation of accidents and incidents.

The output of the assessment is recorded in the management review/annual plan document, in which concrete improvement actions are established. Management ensures follow-up of the KAM annual plan including the actions.
